intro: Loewia tanaensis, commonly known as the Tanaensis loewia, is a flowering plant native to Ethiopia. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes milkweeds and related species. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow or orange. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in woodland areas or along stream banks. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native range.
